args.query: countable basis simply connected open sets fundamental group countable

result: {"ok": true, "results": [{"nl": "For a topological space $X$, a countable index set $\\iota$, a family of sets $s : \\iota \\to \\mathcal{P}(X)$, and a doubly indexed family of compact sets $K : \\iota \\times \\mathbb{N} \\to \\mathcal{P}(X)$, suppose for every $i \\in \\iota$ and $n \\in \\mathbb{N}$, $K(i, n)$ is compact. Moreover, assume that for each $i \\in \\iota$, the union of $K(i, n)$ over all $n \\in \\mathbb{N}$ equals $s(i)$. Given that the union over $i \\in \\iota$ of $s(i)$ is eq

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set Topology

/--
Let X be a path connected topological space that admits a countable basis of simply connected open sets.
Then the fundamental group of X (based at any point) is countable.
-/
theorem fundamental_group_countable_of_countable_basis_of_simply_connected
  {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] (x : X) (hpath : PathConnectedSpace X)
  {B : Set (Set X)} (hB : B.Countable) (hB_open : ∀ U ∈ B, IsOpen U)
  (hB_sc : ∀ U ∈ B, U ∈ B → SimplyConnectedSpace (Subtype U))
  (hcov : ⋃₀ B = (univ : Set X)) :
  Countable (FundamentalGroup X x) := by
  sorry
